trial_identification.studytitle: alpha lipoic acid in burning mouth syndrome:a randomized double-blind placebo-controlled crossover trial
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of alpha lipoic acid in the management of burning mouth syndrome

interventions.interventions: therapy with alpha lipoic acid orally, three capsules of 200 mg per day during 30 days There was a washout period of 20 days
interventions.comparator: cellulose starch orally 100 mg , three capsules per day during 30 days in identical capsules

primaryOutcome.outcome: this study failed to demonstrate effectiveness for alpha lipoic acid over placebo

secondaryOutcome.outcome: secondary oral complaints dry mouth and disgeusia were observed in mostly of the patients

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: burning mouth for 6 months or more, absence of oral mucosal lesions, absence of sistemic conditions whose could produce burning mouth
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: oral burning under 6 months sistemic diseases (anemia and diabetes) oral mucosal diseases, hypossalivation

trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation by using a randomization table created by a computer software (i.e., computerised sequence generation)
